p.span: Elkhorn Public Schools will operate without students in buildings, distance learning will continue through May 15, 2020

div.p:
Please visit our Resources for Parents website for additional assistance.
Temporary Distance Learning Resources for Parents

div.class: et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_1 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et_pb_section_parallax et-last-child

div.p: The Elkhorn Public Schools unites students, families, educators, and the community to ensure a challenging and enriching academic environment that inspires students to develop the knowledge and skills necessary to become responsible citizens and lifelong learners.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-66386 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news et-doesnt-have-format-content et_post_format-et-post-format-standard

h2.a: EPS Now Providing Free Meals to Youth

div.p: EPS was recently approved for a waiver allowing us to begin providing free meals for children ages 1-18 in our community. In response to this waiver, beginning on Monday, April 27, 2020, free breakfast and lunch will be available to any child, ages 1-18, even if a...

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-66382 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news et-doesnt-have-format-content et_post_format-et-post-format-standard

h2.a: ELKHORN PUBLIC SCHOOLS HIGH SCHOOLS NAMED TOP TWO IN NEBRASKA BY US NEWS & WORLD REPORT

div.p: Elkhorn South High School and Elkhorn High School were recently named the top two high schools in Nebraska according to US News & World Report. The rankings are released annually in conjunction with RTI International global research firm. “Being named the Top 2...

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-66326 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news et-doesnt-have-format-content et_post_format-et-post-format-standard

div.p: In collaboration with the Omaha Police Department, EPS utilizes Safe2Help to ensure students and families have an anonymous way to report safety concerns. Students, parents, staff, or community members can report safety concerns through Safe2Help via any of the...

p.span: Elkhorn Public Schools is a rapidly growing suburban school district located on the west edge of the Omaha Metro area. Our enrollment continues to climb by more than six percent each year, and we continue to add facilities to accommodate our growing student population. The District offers the cultural, educational and retail advantage of the city, while still maintaining the qualities of a smaller community. We pride ourselves on the achievement of our students and the dedication of our staff.

div.p: It is the policy of Elkhorn Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, religion, veteran status, national or ethnic origin, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, child birth, or related condition, or any other category protected by law in its education programs, administration, policies, employment or other district programs.

p.span: At Elkhorn Public Schools we strive to comply with web accessibility standards. To report a concern or to request assistance, please email us at accessibility@epsne.org.
